DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor TNM Clinical Stage Description TNM Stage Description Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identifies the AJCC clinical stage (prefix/suffix) descriptor as recorded by the physician. Descriptors identify special cases that require separate data analysis (e.g. neoadjuvant therapy).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor TNM Clinical Stage Description
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The AJCC clinical stage (prefix/suffix) descriptor as recorded by the physician.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredDefinition: A system of clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:Description; a statement that represents something in words.

Concepts.definition: A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system of clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment. (On-line Medical Dictionary)_The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unknown, not stated in patient record

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: M (Multiple primary tumors in a single site)
No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment. (On-line Medical Dictionary):The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:Description; a statement that represents something in words.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 12.1, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 12.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (6/2010)

ReferenceDocuments.name: TNM Clin Descriptor Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: AJCC stage descriptors identify special cases that need separate data analysis. The descriptors are adjuncts to and do not change the stage group. Pathologic, clinical, and other stage data are given three separate areas in the NAACCR Data Exchange Record Layout. COC defines a descriptor and 'Staged By' item for each of these three areas.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 16, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 16 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (01/2016)
